description: Heated Treated Wood Pallets are required for the Canadian Forces Supply Depots
full_summary:
# Heated Treated Wood Pallet – Invitation to Tender
## Reference and Solicitation Information

* Reference: `WS3554846461-Doc3737326289`
* Solicitation: `WS3554846461`
* Publication Date: `2023-02-02`
* Closing Date: `2023-06-20T14:00:00`

## Amended Invitation
This solicitation has undergone multiple amendments; the current amendment level is `9` with the last amendment date set to `2023-06-15`.

## Procurement Details
The Government of Canada invites qualified suppliers to submit a response to the Request for Standing Offer for Heated Treated Wood Pallets. The governement requires Heated Treated Wood Pallets on an as and when requested basis to supply the Canadian Forces Supply Depots (CFSD) in two locations: Edmonton (Alberta) and Montreal (Quebec).

## Eligibility and Qualification
Eligible suppliers must register on the `Ariba Supplier Portal` before submitting their response. Suppliers are encouraged to review the solicitation documents carefully before initiating response preparation.

## Procurement Category
This procurement falls under the `Goods and Services` category (GD). The sole evaluating factor is the `lowest price` for the delivery of Heated Treated Wood Pallets.

## Tariff and Taxation
The proposed contract is subject to the terms and conditions of the following Free Trade Agreements (FTAs): Canada-Colombia FTA, Canadian FTA, CPTPP, Canada-Honduras FTA, NAFTA (sunset clause), Canada-UK TCA, Canada-Panama FTA, CETA, CCFTA, CKFTA, WTO GPA, CPFTA, CUFTA.

## Contact Information
For assistance or inquiries, please contact Nalida Wilson-Bahun (PSPC/SPAC) at `nalida.wilson-bahun@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca`.

## Accessing the Solicitation
The complete solicitation, including any amendments, can be downloaded from the `Ariba Supplier Portal` using the following URL: `http://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/15303519?extsite=MTUzMDM1MTlfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==`. Suppliers must register and log in to access the solicitation documents.

---

I tried to keep the original information as intact as possible, but made it sound more officially technical
